title: Stacey Cunningham, First Female NYSE President, to Step Down
sub_head: Cunningham to be succeeded by Lynn Martin, an executive at NYSE’s parent company
body:
New York Stock Exchange President Stacey Cunningham will leave her job at the end of the year, the NYSE’s parent company said Monday.
Ms. Cunningham became the first woman to lead the exchange when she was appointed in 2018. She is being succeeded by Lynn Martin, an executive at NYSE parent Intercontinental Exchange Inc., known as ICE.
